page.title: 16VALE OF CLWYD.
page.content: There are still homes without {electricity,hot water or sanitation}in the Vale of Clwyd.We visited a stone cottage built around{1760}standing in O'lacre.It has small rooms, small windows, low doorways and uneven slate floors. Sanitation consists of an Elsan bucket in an outside shed, chamber pots and a sit-up bath hanging on the wall. Here lives a retired couple who worked among natives in Zimbabwe for many years. They eat a mainly vegetarian diet. Days are spent gathering wood, gardening walking, writing & reading many letters, filling oil lamps, listening to BBC radio 4 & entertaining visitors from many parts of the world. They are extremely optimistic about the furture, and see the beginning of a trend back to rural life as a sign of hope for western civilisation.
